content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.120 - Executive order no. 120: establishing the state council on food and nutrition

State Regulations
I, Hugh L. Carey, Governor of the State of New York, by
virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of the State
of New York, do hereby establish within the Executive Department and
interdepartmental council on food and nutrition policy, to be known as the

State Council on Food and Nutrition. I. Powers and Responsibilities

The State Council on Food and Nutrition shall advise and
make recommendations to the Governor concerning: the administration of food and nutrition programs in the

State; the coordination of State agency activities involving food
and nutrition; the development of policies to promote adequate nutrition
and to ensure the availability of sufficient food resources in the

State; the development of policies promoting the production, processing and distribution of food; and the establishment of a nutritional
monitoring system to identify persons and populations at risk of inadequate
nutrition. II. Membership

The Council shall consist of the Commissioner of Health, the Commissioner of Agriculture and Markets, the Commissioner of Education, the

Commissioner of Social Services, the Commissioner of Environmental

Conservation, the Commissioner of Labor, the Commissioner of the Office of

General Services, the Commissioner of Commerce, the Director of the Office for
the Aging, the Chairman of the State Soil and Water Conservation Committee and
the Director of the State Consumer Protection Board. The Governor shall designate a chairperson and a
vice-chairperson from among the members. III. Personnel

The Council shall, to the extent feasible, make use of
existing staff and resources in the member State agencies, which are hereby
directed to render full cooperation and assistance to the Council. The
chairperson may employ such staff and assistants as he may deem necessary, at a
compensation to be fixed within the amount available therefor, subject to the
approval of the Director of the Budget. IV. Food and Nutrition Advisory Board

In order to provide the State the broadest policy advice in
matters of food and nutrition policy, a Food and Nutrition Advisory Board is
hereby established, to consist of representatives of organizations and groups
concerned with food, agriculture, animal husbandry and nutrition, to advise and
make recommendations to the State Council on Food and Nutrition. The members of
the Advisory Board shall be appointed by the Governor. Signed: Hugh L. CareyDated: September 30, 1982
